doc.field: Swedish industrial production rose 2.6 pct in February, after a 1.8 pct fall in January, showing a 4.4 pct rise over February 1986 and reaching its highest level ever, the Central Bureau of Statistics said. The rise reflected recovery in almost all sectors after an exceptionally cold spell in January, the Bureau said, adding that the highest rises were seen in the forest, chemical and metal industries. REUTER
